name: kefta tagine
ingredients: 500g of ground meat (beef, or a mix of lamb/beef)
2 garlic cloves (for the meatballs) + 3 garlic cloves (for the sauce)
6 sun-dried tomatoes (or cherry tomatoes as an alternative)
A pinch of chili flakes (or harissa/fresh chili)
steps: Prepare the base of the sauce: Mince 3 garlic cloves and gently saut√© them off the heat in warm olive oil. Add 1 tbsp of cumin, 1 tsp of paprika, salt, pepper, and chili flakes.
Add the sun-dried tomatoes (or cherry tomatoes) and 300g of water along with some chopped cilantro. Mix well.

Prepare the meatballs: In a mixing bowl, combine the ground meat, 2 minced garlic cloves, the egg, breadcrumbs, and a bit of the first spice mixture (cumin, paprika, ginger). Season with salt and pepper. Shape into meatballs.
Add the meatballs to the sauce. Bring to a boil, cover, and let simmer for 3 hours on very low heat. Occasionally baste the meatballs with the sauce.
Add fresh cilantro leaves just before serving.
